text: Cooking the Red sauce Heat 3 to 4 tablespoons olive oil or regular oil in a deep pan. The pan needs to be deep enough to accommodate all of the ingredients for the red sauce. Add the ginger-garlic paste. Let it cook for 2 minutes. Then add the onion paste. Let it cook till slightly brown. Add the tomatoes and the golden corn and mix well. Cover with a lid for 2 minutes. Then put in the ketchup. Mix again and cover for 4-5 minutes. Once it is uncovered, you will find it nicely saucy in texture. Then add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. The red sauce is now ready. Cooking the White Sauce Heat the butter in a shallow pan. Olive oil can be substituted, if preferred. Once it is melted, take it off the flame and place onto your kitchen slab or a heat-safe board. Add flour (continuously whisking it) to the extent of arriving at a soft, fluffier texture. Return to the heat. Once this consistency is achieved, put the pan back onto the flame (low) and now add milk (continuously stirring) to create a saucy texture. Add the seasonings now. Let the sauce simmer till you get the kind of texture that can easily be spread over the lasagna.  Preparing the Lasagna Sheets Cook the lasagna sheets if they're not already instant. If instant, skip this section. Take a deep vessel and fill it three fourths of the way with water. Add 4-5 drops of oil so that when the lasagna is added, the sheets won't stick to each other. Add 5 sheets of lasagna pasta from the pack. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes (or as long as instructed by the packaging). Strain the water. Lay the lasagna sheets one by one on a flat surface. Mostly, a plastic tray would do. Baking the Lasagna Grate a sufficient sized block of cheese to pamper your taste buds.  Get a wide microwave proof dish that is shallow enough to contain the size of a big loaf of bread and wide enough to accommodate the length of the lasagna sheet.  Grease the whole dish with butter.  Lay the red sauce evenly on the base of the dish. Then add a sheet of lasagna. Spread white sauce over it followed by some shredded mozzarella cheese. Then spread the red sauce, another lasagna sheet, white sauce spread evenly and some cheese. Continue with these steps till the final sheet of lasagna comes on top. Spread and cover the whole sheet of lasagna as well as all gaps with the remaining white sauce. Spread all the shredded cheese as much as you would like over the top. Cook. There is no preheating of the microwave required. Simply place in the dish and turn on the settings for convection mode or baking mode at 140 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes, or till the crust of the dish is golden brown. Finished.
